alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:05PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw, Monroe, north central Baldwin, Washington, Clarke, southwestern Wilcox and west central Conecuh Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 705 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Thomasville to near Silas. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Jackson, Thomasville, Frisco City, Grove Hill, Chatom, Peterman, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Whatley, Tibbie, Millry, Excel, Silas, Beatrice, Fruitdale, Coffeeville, Fulton and Repton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox
